name: CreatePullRequest
description: Automatically create a Pull Request for Azure DevOps or GitHub repository from Build or Release pipeline, supports also multi target branch.
author: Shayki Abramczyk

inputs.name: repoType
inputs.label: Git repository type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the git repository type, Azure DevOps (Azure Repos) or GitHub

inputs.name: githubEndpoint
inputs.label: GitHub Connection (authorized with PAT)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the service endpoint for your GitHub connection. must be authorized with PAT.
To create one, click the Manage link and create a new service endpoint.

inputs.name: sourceBranch
inputs.label: Source branch name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The branch name that you will be merged (for exmaple - feature). the deafult is '$(Build.SourceBranch)'.

inputs.name: targetBranch
inputs.label: Target(s) branch name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The target branch name (for example - master). Supports also multi target branch with * (for example: test/*).

inputs.name: reviewers
inputs.label: Reviewers (Azure DevOps: email address, GitHub: username)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The pull request reviewers (optional).
For Azure DevOps - one or more email addresses separated by semicolon. for example: test@test.com;pr@pr.com
For GitHub - one or more usernames separated by semicolon. for example: username;testuser

inputs.name: isDraft
inputs.label: Create Draft Pull Request
inputs.helpMarkDown:
If checekd the pull request will be a Draft Pull Request.
For Azure DevOps: see [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/repos/git/pull-requests?view=azure-devops#draft-pull-requests) more info.
For GitHub: see [here](https://github.blog/2019-02-14-introducing-draft-pull-requests/) more info.
